headline: M&A and IPOs Worth Billions Stalled in 24 Hours by Trade War
summary: (Bloomberg) -- Billions of dollars worth of acquisitions and initial public offerings are on hold as Donald Trump’s trade war upends the global economy, twisting the knife into a dealmaking market that had already struggled to get going this year.Most Read from BloombergHousing Agency Aims to Relocate Its DC HeadquartersLocal Governments Vie for Fired Federal WorkersMetro-North Is Faster Than Acela on NYC-New Haven Route After Signal UpdatesWhat Would ‘Transportation Abundance’ Look Like?Hochul

headline: Private-Equity Stocks Feel Market Pain—and Then Some
summary: Publicly traded private-equity firms have been among the losers in the tariff-driven market rout.  Shares of Blackstone, Apollo Global Management and KKR were down sharply early Friday, after falling 10%, 13% and 15%, respectively, on Thursday.  Private-equity firms generally represent a leveraged bet on equities.
